title: Calories in 10 Grapes
meta_description: Discover calories in 10 grapes (about 35 kcal), plus carbs, sugars, protein, fat, and a full nutrition profile to help track your intake.
assumptions: Fresh, seedless red grapes, average size (~5 g each), eaten with skin.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by grape variety, size, ripeness, and growing conditions. Values are approximate; check sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 10 average grapes provide about 35 kcal, mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Skin removed (lose some fiber and minor calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in one grape?

faqs.a: Yes, 10 grapes have ~8 g natural sugars, but also provide fiber and hydration.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 10 grapes?
faqs.a: Approximately 9 g carbs, including 0.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Do grapes have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Very low: ~0.1 g fat and 0.4 g protein in 10 grapes.

faqs.q: How does grape size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger grapes have more calories; 10 jumbo grapes could reach 70 kcal.
